src:
Rapper Korea Jessi Tampilkan Wayang dalam Video Musik 'Drip'
02 Nov 2019, 19:57 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Di bagian awal video musik Drip, Jessi terlihat memegang wayang golek dan mengundang komentar positif para penonton Indonesia. (Foto: Dok. PNation/Jessi)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Rapper Jessi kembali merilis video musik terbaru pada Jumat (1/11). 'Drip' menjadi comeback sekaligus digital single terbaru Jessi usai merilis single perdana di P Nation, 'Who Dat B' pada September lalu.Video musik terbaru Jessi bersama CEO AOMG Jay Park itu menarik perhatian banyak orang, terutama orang Indonesia. Pasalnya, wayang golek menjadi salah satu pembuka video yang berdurasi 3 menit 35 detik tersebut.Tak hanya itu, Jessi juga terlihat memegang wayang golek di awal video. Wayang golek juga menghiasi tangga yang menjadi salah satu lokasi utama kemunculan Jessi dan Jay Park di video Drip.Penonton asal Indonesia pun meramaikan kolom komentar video Drip Jessi di YouTube. Salah satunya adalah Pramuji Pramuji yang memberi tahu kalau boneka di video Jessi adalah wayang golek dan berasal dari Jawa, Indonesia.Hal serupa disampaikan akun Siti Irmawati. "Itu merupakan boneka tradisional dari Indonesia dan disebut Golek. Saya tak tahu arti wayang itu dalam video ini tapi saya bangga kesenian Indonesia dikenal industri K-pop," tulisnya."0:11 Wayang Golek dari Indonesia. Jessi selalu menarik perhatian," komentar akun Rini Bola."Itu wayang golek dari Indonesia. Bangga menjadi warga negara Indonesia dan lagu ini hit!," tulis akun Spearbies.Drip merupakan lagu yang benar-benar menggambarkan kepercayaan diri serta gaya Jessi yang unik. Lagu serta video musik ini pun sekilas mengingatkan dengan nuansa-nuansa Cardi B.Lagu tersebut dibuat langsung oleh Jessi bersama komposer Johnjohn dan CuzD. Jay Park turut berpartisipasi dalam penulisan lirik Drip bersama Jessi dan Johnjohn.




(chri/ayk)
text:
Korean rapper Jessi shows wayang in 'Drip' music video
02 Nov 2019, 19:57 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


At the beginning of the Drip music video, Jessi is seen holding a puppet show and inviting positive comments from Indonesian audiences. (Photo: Doc. PNation / Jessi)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - Rapper Jessi released the latest music video on Friday (1/11). 'Drip' became the comeback as well as the latest digital single Jessi after releasing the first single on P Nation, 'Who Dat B' last September. Jessi's latest music video with AOMG CEO Jay Park attracted many people, especially Indonesians. Because the puppet show became one of the opening videos that lasted 3 minutes and 35 seconds. Not only that, Jessi was also seen holding the puppet show at the beginning of the video. Puppet show also decorates the stairs which are one of the main locations for the appearance of Jessi and Jay Park in the Drip video. Indonesian watchers also enliven the Drip Jessi video comment column on YouTube. One of them is Pramuji Pramuji who told me that the doll in Jessi's video was a puppet show and came from Java, Indonesia. The same thing was conveyed by Siti Irmawati's account. "It is a traditional puppet from Indonesia and is called Golek. I don't know the meaning of the puppet in this video but I am proud that Indonesian art is known by the K-pop industry," he wrote. "0:11 Puppet Golek from Indonesia. Jessi always attracts attention," commented Rini Bola account. "It's a puppet show from Indonesia. Proud to be an Indonesian citizen and the song is a hit !," wrote the Spearbies.Drip account, a song that truly depicts Jessi's unique self-confidence and style. The song and the music video are also reminiscent of the nuances of Cardi B. The song was made directly by Jessi with composers Johnjohn and CuzD. Jay Park participated in writing Drip lyrics with Jessi and Johnjohn.




(chri / ayk)
